conclusion: A wooden block P of mass m slides on a long wooden board ab of mass M, which is placed on a horizontal ground and remains stationary all the time. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the long wooden board ab and the ground is μ1, and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the wooden block P and the long wooden board ab is μ2.
The image shows a wooden block P of mass m sliding on a long wooden board ab of mass M. The board is placed on a horizontal ground and remains stationary. The block P is moving with velocity v.

premise: The coefficient of kinetic friction between the wooden block P and the wooden board ab is μ2.
conclusion: The frictional force between the wooden block P and the wooden board ab is f = μ2mg.

premise: The wooden block P is sliding on the wooden board ab with a speed v, and there is no information suggesting acceleration or deceleration.
conclusion: The net force on the block P is zero, and the frictional force f = μ2mg is balanced by the normal force and the weight of the block.

premise: The frictional force f = μ2mg is the only horizontal force acting on the wooden board ab.
conclusion: The acceleration of the wooden board ab is a = f/M = μ2mg/M.

premise: The wooden board ab is stationary, and the frictional force exerted by the ground on the wooden board ab balances the frictional force μ2mg.
conclusion: The frictional force exerted by the ground on the wooden board ab is F_ground = μ2mg.
